text.0: the ancients milchcow yields the things we long for the son of dakṣiṇā travels between them.
text.1: she with the splendid chariot brings refulgence the praise of uṣas hath awoke the aśvins.
text.2: they bear you hither by wellorderd statute our sacred offerings rise as if to parents.
text.3: destroy in us the counsel of the niggard come hitherward for we have shown you favour.
text.4: with lightlyrolling car and wellyoked horses hear this the pressstones song ye wonderworkers.
text.5: have not the sages of old time ye aśvins called you most prompt to come and stay misfortune.
text.6: remember us and come to us for ever men as their wont is invocate the aśvins.
text.7: friends as it were have offered you these juices sweet blent with milk at the first break of morning.
text.8: even through many regions o ye aśvins high praise is yours among mankind ye mighty.
text.9: come helpers on the paths which gods have travelled here your libations of sweet meath are ready.
text.10: ancient your home auspicious is your friendship heroes your wealth is with the house of jahnu.
text.11: forming again with you auspicious friendship let us rejoice with draughts of meath together.
text.12: o aśvins very mighty ones with vāyu and with his steeds oneminded everyouthful.
text.13: nāsatyas joying in the third days soma drink it not hostile very bounteous givers.
text.14: aśvins to you are brought abundant viands in rivalry with sacred songs unceasing.
text.15: sprung from high law your car urged on by pressstones goes round the earth and heaven in one brief moment.
text.16: aśvins your soma sheds delicious sweetness drink ye thereof and come unto our dwelling.
text.17: your car assuming many a shape most often goes to the somapressers place of meeting.
